content.heading: Paragraphs
paragraphs:
The

element defines a paragraph, starting on a new line with automatic margins.

This is a paragraph.

This is another paragraph.

content.heading: Display Behavior
paragraphs: Browsers ignore extra spaces and lines in HTML code, and display varies across screen sizes.

content.heading: Horizontal Rules
paragraphs: The <hr> tag, an empty tag, creates a thematic break, often shown as a horizontal line:

This is heading 1

This is some text.

This is heading 2

This is some other text.

content.heading: Line Breaks
paragraphs:
The
tag, an empty tag, adds a line break without starting a new paragraph:

content.heading: Preformatted Text
paragraphs: The <pre> element preserves spaces and line breaks, using a fixed-width font:

My Bonnie lies over the ocean.
My Bonnie lies over the sea.
My Bonnie lies over the ocean.
Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.
